Package edu.cmu.cs.prt

Class PrtHistoryTable

java.lang.Object
edu.cmu.cs.prt.PrtHistoryTable
public class PrtHistoryTable extends Object
Represents a collection of HistoryEntry instances, encapsulating data related to vehicle arrival events. This class provides functionality to filter and manipulate a collection of history entries for various analytical purposes. It supports operations like filtering based on different criteria (e.g., date, route ID, stop), calculating average delays, and sorting entries.

The PrtHistoryTable is designed as a singleton to ensure a consistent and centralized management of history entries across the application. It is loaded from a source file and can be filtered to produce new instances of PrtHistoryTable containing a subset of the data.

The PrtHistoryTable supports a variety of filter operations, which return a new PrtHistoryTable that contains a subset of the entries in the original table. Filter operations assume the given object is not null and are valid (e.g. Trip object has valid Route information) This class is immutable.

    • createdAt

      public LocalDateTime createdAt()
      Returns the time this history table was created. This history table will not contain any entries timestamped after this time.

      This method can be used to check how up-to-date this table is.

      Returns:
      time at which this table was created

    • numberOfEntries

      public long numberOfEntries()
      Returns the number of history entries currently stored in this table. This count reflects the current state of this table, accounting for any filtering operations that may have been performed.
      Returns:
      the total number of history entries in this table

    • entryList

      public List<HistoryEntry> entryList()
      Returns all history entries in this table. This method returns numberOfEntries() entries.

      Warning: Expensive if called on a unfiltered or lightly filtered table.

      Returns:
      the history entries in this table

    • averageDeviation

      public Duration averageDeviation()
      Calculates the average deviation across all entries in this history table. If there are no entries in this table, this method defaults to Duration.ZERO, indicating no known delay.

      The "deviation" of a HistoryEntry is the actual arrival time minus the scheduled arrival time for the arrival that the entry corresponds to. Deviation is positive if the arrival is late and negative if the arrival is early. If you want to ignore the magnitude a vehicle is early by, see averageDelay(). For details on deviation, see HistoryEntry.arrivalDeviation(). The precision of the division is determined by Duration.dividedBy(long).

      Returns:
      the average deviation, which may be negative

    • averageDelay

      public Duration averageDelay()
      Calculates the average delay across all entries in this history table. If there are no entries in this table, this method defaults to Duration.ZERO, indicating no known delay.

      The "delay" of a HistoryEntry is the duration of lateness of the arrival that the entry corresponds to. The delay is zero if the arrival is on time or early. If you want to consider how early a vehicle is, see averageDeviation(). For details on delay, see HistoryEntry.arrivalDelay().

      Returns:
      the average delay

    • sortBy

      public PrtHistoryTable sortBy(Comparator<HistoryEntry> comparator)
      Returns a new PrtHistoryTable with history entries from this PrtHistoryTable sorted using the given comparator. The results of a sort can be accessed with topNEntries(int).
      Parameters:
      comparator - the comparator to use for sorting
      Returns:
      a new PrtHistoryTable with sorted entries

    • topNEntries

      public List<HistoryEntry> topNEntries(int n)
      Returns the list of top N entries from this history table, in order from topmost to bottommost. Which entries are considered "topmost" in the history table can be modified using sortBy(Comparator). If this history table is unsorted, the order of the entries is implementation defined.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of top entries to retrieve
      Returns:
      at most N top entries
